user_texts: ['Nice and easy with the kids and dog.  Really nice with the snow on the ground', 'This hike was awesome!! This week, there was still some ice on the ground so it made the trail muddy and slippery. But plenty of great views and huge rocks to take pictures on! I highly recommend this to anyone in big bear!', 'Hiked this trail with my dog. Easy, short. Perfect way to start the day', 'This was perfect to take our 3 year old on a short and simple hike.', 'Beautiful trail in the snow. There are markers to help guide you through the snow. The views you get of the lake and Big Bear mountain are fantastic.', 'Beautiful trail in the snow. There are markers to help guide you through the snow. The views you get of the lake and Big Bear mountain are fantastic.', 'Beautiful trail in the snow. There are markers to help guide you through the snow. The views you get of the lake and Big Bear mountain are fantastic.', 'Beautiful trail in the snow. There are markers to help guide you through the snow. The views you get are fantastic.', 'Easy trail with pretty views. Well marked in the snow!', 'Well marked, nice, short hiking path. Good parking. Easy to find. We walked the loop in less than 30 min.', 'I’ve easy trail and enjoyed the interpretive aspect.', 'Super easy stroll. We did it as a night hike with headlamps and flashlights. Added to the adventure.', 'Great little loop trail.', 'A nice hike. Great location good for photos', 'Nice trail! Relatively quiet, but that probably has to do with off peak season. Easy trail with some ups and downs and nice views. The fir and pine trees also smell also smell amazing.', "Hiked this trail today with my 4 yr. old daughter, wife, and parents. Decent trail for beginners and great scenery. We only saw two people in the trail which was expected since it's a Tuesday. We also ran into a rattlesnake along the path so keep an eye out! Had a great time overall. Highly recommend if staying in Big Bear.", 'Great for beginners but still challenging!', 'A nice easy trail. The trail is dog friendly and has some cool views. There are a couple of nice rock formations around the trail. Just remember to get your adventure pass for the day, the park does check for the pass if you use their parking lot.', 'easy trail to get started. Quiet', 'Easy trail, good for a group with random hiking skills', 'A nice easy trail to enjoy with the family.', 'This trail’s parking needs a recreation pass', 'First time hiking this trail. Our 6 year old had no problem keeping up and led the way most of the hike. Great scenery.', 'Great trail', 'Nice short hike with shades. Definitely do it again.', 'We had a great time under the shade of the beautiful trees. Lots of opportunity to sit and enjoy the views of what’s left of the sadly drying up Big Bear Lake- come see it before it’s a thing of our past. Lots of locals and tourists but not too much traffic for a weekday summer hike. Easy parking. The public restroom was pretty gross! This is a super easy hike. A 5 year old could handle it!', 'Awesome place to hike with a toddler and a hiking backpack', 'Great hike for the whole family. We took our 10, 6, and 3 year olds. The 3 year old was super tired and wanted to be carried part of the way, but it was an easy hike for us and it was a great first hike for the kids. Great views.', "Woodland trail is a nice easy little hike. went there about 3 weeks ago and saw a rattlesnake taking in some sun. if you decide to go, keep your eyes open as it's getting a lot warmer and they're starting to come out.", 'very nice easy trail', 'Loved with with a 2 year old and a small dog. It was just perfect 1 hour easy hike', 'Took our five kids on the trail. It was easy for all ages (youngest is 3). We all loved the nature facts at each station! Lots of great views, too!', 'A perfect trail if you’re looking for a quick nature stroll! Thoroughly enjoyed the scenery and there were some pretty views over the lake. Family friendly and should be doable for most everyone. There were a few uphills, but nothing too bad. The parking lot has a decent amount of spots, but does require an adventure pass.', "The trail offers a beautiful view of the surrounding mountains and of the lake as well.  Big Bear is a beautiful and very scenic area with a lot of outdoor activities to offer whether during the skiing season or not. The trail has a few inclines that can be difficult if you're not in shape or have any medical issues. Great place just to hang out as there are picnic areas around the lake.  Can easily make a nice day out it. Plenty of near by trails as well that range from easy to more advanced levels.", "Nothing exciting, but good if you're in the area with younger kids who aren't up to a mountain hike.", 'If you are wanting a quick hike that is not challenging, this is it. For me, it was a workout! That was mainly because my son (aged 8 and has special needs) decided 1/2 way that he was not going to walk.  I had to carry all 70lbs of him out. That said, even then, the hike was doable.', 'I really enjoyed the hike on this cool morning. So much to see.  Great views, birds, lizards.', 'This trail is perfect for all skill levels. We just wanted a more leisurely hike and this was perfect. It Has small “rolling hills” that would make it perfect for trail running too.', 'Cool little hike takes me like 30-45 mins or so great view of the Lake ! love this trail its a great workout going up hill and then down. Good for training for bigger hikes..', 'Great hike with the kids (9 & 12 y/o). Grabbed a map at the parking lot and took turns reading about each of the 16 markers.', 'loved it & very dog friendly.', 'Nice scenic trail with a bunch of marked destinations to learn about.', 'fun and great for my five yr old!', 'This trail is perfect for us. We are new to hiking and have 4 and 6 year old daughters. This is a good introduction and great for kids.', "This hiking trail is perfect for a family with small kids! We had a blast! It has 16 check in spots, make sure you get a map before starting, they are located by the trail entrance. Also, you will need a parking pass to park in the lot. We loved learning and hiking together. It's about a mile and a half. Enjoy!", 'A simple loop trail with interpretive signs and a handout.', "Super easy trail. Perfect for beginners. Went with my sister who carried a baby on her back the entire time. My dog had a blast. We didn't see very many people. Definitely a fun little trail.", 'Fun little trail. Great view. Bit of a workout and some easy fun', 'Simple, great for first time hikers and little ones.', 'Awesome hike for the family! Not so easy its boring but not to hard either. Me and my son in our osprey poco ag and my pregnant wife and dog lived it! Nice little views of the lake and beautiful trees and flowers! Would do it again!', '7/29/17. A nice little nature walk, not difficult. Saw lots of kids and small dogs on this trail. Wide, maintained trail with good amounts of shade.', 'Easy hike that I picked for two kids and two infants in Ergos. The little paw print facts were fun for the kids to learn some info while hiking.', 'A great day for a hike.  The surroundings and weather were perfect', 'Awesome trail. Beautiful area and nice clean trail.', 'Great little hike for kids', 'Easy beautiful hike with a great view of Big Bear Lake and the city. Restrooms at trailhead.', 'Not difficult but pretty views.', 'Very nice, peaceful hike with beautiful views of the lake.', "This trail is amazing and it's an interpretive loop. The kids had a great time. Fun for all ages.", 'Nice relaxing and informative trail.', 'Easy trail in joyful nice scenery.OLE!', 'This was a really enjoyable little hike. Go to the discovery center a mile down the road to get a hike guide...nice interactive map. The hike itself is really gentle. Beautiful views!', 'I love going on this hike as a quick workout to get my heart rate up!', 'this is a fun quick and very scenic trail. a favorite of mine', 'Easy going trail. Good scenery. No lake view but very nice walk.', 'Very easy. Beautiful forest and views of the lake.', 'really enjoyed this trail. it was short, but my kids enjoyed climbing and running on everything.. it was a great way to start the morning on our vacation in big bear!', 'Lovely trail and views. Perfect after-breakfast hike. Unfortunately we ran into Ranger Sunshine who was all full of attitude about the parking (Adventure Pass needed or park out on the road). Shame on him for darkening our otherwise beautiful morning.', 'Great Trail for kids!', 'Nice trail to take the kids on. Short and easy with information about the flora and fauna to teach the little ones', 'great easy hike. kid friendly which is what I wanted! beautiful views!', 'Its a lovely trail.  Nice views and trees.  Well marked and groomed.', 'Nice and easy hike, specially if you have kids. Make sure to grab the pamphlet at the beginning of the trail to read interesting facts at each point. Some points have small rock formations to climb.', "Great for pets. This is a super easy hike, great for people that are not used to hiking. My husband who doesn't really hike and my 3 dogs loved it. Beautiful.", 'Great trail for families! Take the time to read about each stop, it really adds to the experience.', "Been here twice with my 8 and 5 yr olds, and our 5 month old puppy. Perfect for family's, or people who don't normally do physical activity. Rocks to climb on, views of the (small) big bear lake. You have to have a pass to park in the parking lot. We park on the street right across. There is a bathroom and trash can. Very easy to navigate. GREAT spots for pictures.", 'Super easy trail. Good for young kids. I am rehabbing a knee injury so also good if you have some mobility issues. Lots of people there on a weekday. Probably more interesting in spring. You need an adventure pass to park in the lot.', "Nicest trail I've been on in years", 'Plesant easy short trail. Good rock formation at marker 12 to climb. Started on marker 15 and hiked the loop back to marker 1. Better view of the lake on the higher marker numbers. Then had lunch at Big Bear village.', 'Great trail for a short run with some hills to build muscles and endurance.', 'Start from the end (marker 15) to get to best spot (12) where you can climb on the rock formation with the best view of the lake!', "The trail was fun.  It was dusty.  We saw some small wildlife. Lots of people but it's the 4th of July weekend. A good easy trail to have fun with the family. About 1.5 hike.", 'Nice hike. Did with my two kids two and four. They both did pretty well. My 4 year old did the entire hike by himself. Two year old maybe did a third of it. Soon enough he will be there. Saw a small rattle snake in the first part of the trail. Got some good pictures.', 'Awesome super easy first hike for me and my dog ', 'Easy, guided trail. Great for kids because you can pick up an informational guide/map at the onset. Lots of ecological information.', 'not a hard trail relatively short but very nice and relaxing', "Very easy, well marked trail. I once did this on a field trip with first graders and they were able to hike it. Look for the cacti at the top of the trail.  They're a great example of what happens when two biomes are so close together.", 'Easy, wide trail ...well marked and hardly any rocks or uphill .. Nice views of the lake', 'Very easy & short hike. Good for families and kids.', 'Great trail for families! If you have the time it is perfect for kiddos to explore, climb on small boulders, balance on logs and enjoy nature. Beautiful low altitude views of the lake.', 'A great, light hike for the family.  Always a hike that we bring visitors with small children to.  It is an interpretive trail - so be sure to stop at the Ranger Station near the trailhead to pick up the guide to follow along the points of interest on the trail.', 'Pretty good trail. . saw a couple squirrels and a lion.  Beautiful place.', 'Very fun trail. The first 5 markers are at a small incline but there are benches every so often. the trail guide has some interesting info on the local trees and wildlife. Good views of the lake towards the end. Bring water and all in all a pretty nice hike.', 'This is our first hike in big bear, I am very glad we hiked this trail, it was fairly easy and beautiful.  we took about 40 mins.  it is a great spot to look at the lake when the sunsets.  I would recommend this trail. great trail and great views. it did have some snow but not very much, would recommend to bring a jacket.', "Easy going trail that's also dog friendly. Great for kids and families too. Grab a pamphlet at the trail head and learn about the local landscape via numbered signs as you make your way around the loop. Easy parking too!", 'Brought my kids and friends.  This was a great walk with informational post along the way.', 'Great fall colors. ', "An easy trail with nice views of the lake. It has a couple spots to climb rocks to get a even better look at the lake. Great if you don't have much time but want to get a hike in.", "Very easy trail and not very rewarding fitness-wise. However, there are some great rocks to climb and it's perfect for a romantic hand-in-hand walk. Happy Trails!", 'Very easy trail. Our group had people ranging from ages 3 to 63. Awesome views and there are a bunch of signs posted with a brochure to accompany them explaining cool nature facts.', 'Nice and easy trail, good for kids and dogs. Just what I expected ', 'Easily hikable.  Family friendly. Dog friendly. Well maintained. Well Marked. Mostly shady. Great views of the lake. My favorite part of the trail is at the top (at the saddle) there is a bench to sit on that overlooks the lake.', 'Easy hike. Lots of families with small children on this hike. It is an interpretive trail, but they were out of brochures.', 'Nice trail. Well marked, ample parking, thick woods, good for the dogs. Missed a star because of road noise and missed one for some deforestation.', 'Very good for kids. Well maintained and the interpretive guides keep the kids engaged. Several bouldering sections to scramble up, but most suitable for Tweens. Good photo ops as well. ', "A fun littel hike. Grate way to start or end your day with this trail. I like it because if don't have the time for a long hike or just wont to relax this is the trail. Very popular trail, so early mornings on week ends and mid week not so bad.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

hike_description: Bertha Peak Trail is a 6.8 mile moderately trafficked out and back trail located near Big Bear City, California that features a lake and is rated as moderate. The trail is primarily used for hiking and trail running and is best used from March until September. Dogs are also able to use this trail.

user_texts:
['We took a wrong turn and turned it into an 8.2 miler...but still I think 6.8 is short. I think it’s more like 7.5. Great hike.  Very easy until the last mile which is a very steep uphill climb on a fire road. Beautiful view from the top. For me, even though it’s longer, it seemed easier than the Gray’s Peak trail.', 'Nice hike most of the way until the end where it becomes a very steep fire road. When you get to the top it is a very pretty view but not much room as if it covered with radio towers. Not quite the peaceful peak we had imagined. But there are some small trees so we hung the hammock and made the best of it watching a beautiful sunset.', 'Nice trail. Started at Serrano camp ground. There is a tunnel under the road to the trail head. Nice view over valley after first couple miles. last turn to peak steep rocky access road. view from top worth the climb.', 'zzx', 'One of the best scenic view in all of Big Bear Lake.', 'The view is breathtaking', 'It was very hot and dry, so carry plenty of water. Trail is well maintained with great views. The last half mile or so was very steep. My GPS recorded 7.2 mile to the top of Bertha Peak.', "Nice hike. More easy than moderate. Many people seen wearing only very  simple shoes. Than it can't be very difficult. Great views but the lake disappointed a little.", 'Fun hike, great views.', 'good hike with great views from the peak. very steep near the top. my dog also liked it.', "I did Bertha Peak about week or so ago for the first time, and it was a good hike up until you get to the climb for Bertha itself and then it becomes challenging. definitely a good workout and climb, and the view of the lake once you're up there is pretty badass. definitely recommended.", 'Nice trail the last 1/4 miles is pretty tuff worth the view though', 'great hike the last 1/4 mile a killer', 'Very nice hike with lots of panoramic views.', 'Great hike fairly easy,', 'Great views. Moderately challenging at the end with large incline. Overall pretty nice hike.', 'Great hike', 'good hike, great views, ruined with a giant satellite at the top.', 'Amazing hike! Great views. Nice and steady.', 'Nice view from the top. The cougar crest half isn’t to bad but once you hit the road there are some good climbs.', 'Great hike with easy to follow trail. You can park for free at the big bear discovery centre & walk along the short connection trail from there to the start of the trail head.', 'nice trail.', "Starts in the North side of Big Bear. Parking lot holds about 40 cars. Some sites say its a 4 hour hike.The first 3 miles is a fairly gradual slope, kinda easy. The last 1/2 mile gets pretty steep and challenging. You get to see the pump station at the peak from time to time as you round some corners. The views are some of the best I've seen!  We ran down and completed it in 2:19.", 'great winter hike the Sun hits this side of the mountain there for the snow melt pretty quickly making it a great winter hike and a great view of the desert side and the lake', 'Nice hike with amazing views of Big Bear Lake. Not hard at all but there are some steep sections. Overall a great hike!', "Loved every minute!!! Trail isn't too hard and the views are awesome", "We hiked this trail today and it was absolutely amazing. It is a little challenging, especially towards the end getting up to the peak. The views are incredible and there are lots of little side trails and places to stop and picnic or just rest and take in the views. The place is pristine - not a single piece of trash or litter anywhere - great to see people so respectful! The weather was perfect - definitely bring a lot of water and stay hydrated - your sweat evaporates (as it should) in the altitude and so it's hard to tell you're working so hard without seeing the sweat. We had a large camelback that lasted for the trip, and a few granola bars as well. Stop by the North Shore Cafe when you're done for a drink and a bite!", "We parked at the Cougar Crest parking lot and hiked to Bertha's Peak from there. Definitely challenging for amateur hikers but doable! The trail seems to split at one point past the PCT trail marker and its not clearly marked which direction you should take. However, if you stay to the left you will be following the access road which would be the best option for those who aren't so sure footed. If you take the fork to the right it will be a steep and rocky incline that meets up with the access road so either path will keep you headed in the right direction. We ate lunch at the peak and enjoyed the gorgeous view of Big Bear lake. Another hiker offered to take a group photo of us with the lake in the background. Very thoughtful and it created a great memory for our group!", 'Beautiful views all along this trail. Bring plenty of water with you. The Cougars Crest portion of this trail is pretty rocky so watch your footing. The last turn onto the access road to go up to the peak is pretty steep but do able. Also must have an adventure pass when parking at the trail head or they will ticket you.', "Great hike with beautiful views of big bear. Had a picnic lunch at the top. A little challenging for my hubby at times, but considering he's coming up on one year since his triple bypass, I think he did amazing. The hardest part were the switch backs after you get to the end of the cougar crest trail. Would do again.", 'Always a great hike. Had to park in the Discovery Center parking lot as the Cougar Crest lot was full. Hiked with my kid. The last 1/2 mile to Bertha Peak is real steep but doable. Just take a few breaks if you need it. Views along the Cougar crest, PCT and Bertha are amazing. Took us 4.5 hours round trip which included a 30 minute break at the summit towers/buildings. Kinda rocky in spots but pretty much dirt trails and the dirt access road to the summit. I would rate this as a moderate 6.5 mile hike.', 'My daughter and I hiked up to Bertha this morning!  Good trail, pretty easily marked, and a steady climb.  I suggest one goes early in the morning.  Less people and cooler temperatures!', 'Very nice trail. Keep a fast pace to get a decent workout. Dog friendly, my Aussie was off leash most of the way. On leash when we came about other dogs on leash.', "We have always loved hiking up to the PCT via the Cougar Crest trail. Today we went a bit further and took the PCT about a1/2 mile (south?) before turning right at the metal post which indicates the Bertha's Peak Trail. (the letters are so faded, don't count on being able to read it!) There is no mistaking the upwards hill that takes you on the BP trail, though! There is a straight up hill covered in white rocks. Yup! That's it! It felt like getting to the BP trail was fairly easy, especially because we got there early before the sun could bake us, but once you start the upwards rocky road to BP, it gets a bit more challenging. It's the perfect amount of challenge though. It's a little demanding while you're doing it, but you know you can do it, and then you're super glad you did do it. I have always enjoyed the views of Big Bear Lake from the Cougar Crest trail...but I gotta say...the views from the PCT and from Bertha's Peak are superior, making that challenge at the end very rewarding! What a great day to be outdoors!", 'Hiked this with my family all the way to the top! It was amazing! A little long for my 9 month old but she was a trooper and did great in the carrier! Definitely doing this again!', 'Great trail for beginners and children. The trail is well maintained with a few benches a long the path, and is easy enough that our toddler navigated it just fine!', 'I loved it. Bring water and snacks', "I hiked this trail back in 2015 and took it to the top by the towers.  The trail is beautiful and gives you a great view of Big Bear Lake.  The last part when you are close to the towers goes straight up an access dirt road.  When heading back down make sure not to miss the turn off for the trail.  It is easy to miss and you will end up down the mountain miles from the trailhead.  This last Memorial Weekend we headed towards this trail again, but didn't have enough time to do the whole trail.  Even though we didn't have enough time it still did not disappoint.  With only a short distance up you get a magical view of the lake.  This trail is also tucked away on the back side of Big Bear lake making the trail not as crowded as the trails closer to the Village.  Read more about our last trip on my blog
https://lovz2hike.com/2017/06/10/fishing-with-coyotes-and-hiking-cougar-crest-trail-big-bear/

Happy Hiking :)", 'Great hike.', 'incredible views, beautiful. fairly  easy hike', 'As per previous reviews, the last 1/4 mile is a the kicker.  
Very beautiful views of the lake all along this hike.', "This is an amazing hike! It's quite long (took me a little over 4 hours to do), but the view is well worth it.", "If you're trekking from the more mild Cougar Crest Trail, Bertha throws in an final, surprisingly intense, leg  burn just before spilling you out on top of a nice vista .  Forge the few extra steps up to the electrical station (?). We were able to grab a rest and some nice shots!", 'Nice.', 'Nice hike beautiful scenery but look out for the mountain bikes. We were nearly taken out by a group coming around the bend at top speed', "not a bad hike overall. 7 miles in and out. trail is dusty and somewhat rocky through certain areas. the last section is the steepest and most rocky. when we got near the peak, there were a crew of tree trimmers around the power station. so we weren't able to see the absolute top of the peak. kinda of a bummer.", 'The peak has generators and power lines on top and the last .08 miles is very steep and dusty. The view is just as good from the top of Cougar Crest Trail. Had I known, I would have skipped the last bit up the PCT and on to Bertha Peak.', 'Hiked up to the peak with my boyfriend on Sunday morning. Hard for me, but made it to the top. Nice views, resting spots.', 'Great experience. You start at Cougar Crest and up thru the PCT. great panoramic view of the lake. Last  3/4 of a mile is steep with loose rock.', 'Great workout. Nice and quiet. Awesome views.', "This was a fun hike that took about 4.5 hours including a break a the peak. The trails were easy to follow from the Cougar Crest Trail up to the Pacific Crest Trail and up to Berthas Peak. The majority of the trail was pretty easy, but rocky and the last 3/4 of a mile to the peak becomes pretty steep and rocky. Overall, the weather was great, the trail was fun and we couldn't have asked for a better day.", 'Pretty long for us but worth it', 'Saw deer! Took my dog and teenager, it was quite easy for all', 'Nice trail! Took off from Cougar Crest. Bring lots of water and make sure to wear good boots.', 'Nice little out and back with some friends. Affords nice views of big bear stating half way up. The last mile can be fairly strenuous so be prepared.', 'One of my favorite hikes in Socal. Incredible views and not too busy.', 'We began at the Cougar Crest trailhead at the Discovery Science Center which at the beginning, was a paved trail.  The trail turned to dirt and was easy most the way up. Our goal was to reach Bertha Peak.  The last part of the trail berfore you reach Bertha Peak is pretty steep.  The radio tower at the top is sort of a let down but the panoramic views of Big Bear Lake and Holcomb Valley are unreal.  Overall, it was a pretty easy trail and a nice day hike escape from the city.', 'Pretty easy hike. Nice, wide trail. Very clean and quiet. I brought my 9 year with me, and he endured just fine.', 'My favorite trail so far. Great view.', 'I love this hike. Enough elevation for a workout - but do-able. Fantastic views of the lake and surrounding mountains. And fun for the dog. Beautiful.', 'Great trail. Rocky at times but overall fairly maintained. Pretty Moderate for the first 2 miles, the it gets pretty steep once you turn right to jump on the OHV trail to get to Bertha Peak. Views are definitely worth the hike, be sure to check out the back side of the mountain.', 'Beautiful, easy afternoon hike. Go there and watch the sunset. Icy/ muddy in the winter, wear hiking boots to avoid slipping.', "Very beautiful trail, almost always a scenic view! Steady climb up most of the mountain. However the original posting is a bit deceptive when it says this is cougar crest trail (leading up to Bertha Peak). Cougar crest ends about a mile before the trek the Bertha peak. The trek from the end of CC to Bertha Peak is quite steep, but so rewarding when you get to the top. Also I wouldn't say you need to go to Bertha Peak to get all the views you can pretty much see them throughout the hike. Lots of friendly people and benches to rest along the away. It was a day's hike but very beautiful!", 'Fantastic trail, good climb lots to see and great even in mid February.  Moderate difficulty', 'Very nice trail. You can go on the PCT for a few miles and hike back to Big Bear via the van Dusen Canyon Road.', "Beautiful trail. It's a bit rocky in some places but worth the hike. When I made it to the top most of the trees were covered in icicles which meant it was frigid, but pretty. Will definitely be hiking this trail again in the spring~", 'Nice trail. A little rocky, so good shoes are important. Bertha Peak was pretty steep.', 'Nice day hike with pretty views of Big Bear Lake and a chance to hit the PCT too.', 'Trail is beautiful, amazing nature, very silent. Although was disappointed with the peak itself. Has couple of fenced buildings on it. Feeling of "reaching it" unfortunately left me at that point :(', 'Nice tracks.', 'Nice shades areas! Nice views of Big Bear Lake!', 'Cougar crest is a great trail with terrific views.  Once you connect with the PCT at the top of Cougar Crest - you will hike to a jeep road for the ascent to the peak.  A great hike all around.  Views were actually more spectacular from the CC and PCT vs at the Peak.', "Great trail!... First time hikers be prepared for a long hike. Fairly easy. Only hard part is the last part climbing Bertha's Peak. Very steep at times. Take your time with this one. We did it Round trip in 3 1/2 hrs.  Take lots of water.", 'Very rocky trails. We hoped to run this trail but mostly had to walk due to the jagged rocks.Fun, nonetheless!', "The view of Big Bear Lake is quite impressive from the top of  Bertha Peak.  The trail is hard and rocky in a lot of places; my dog (who is 12) refuses to do it anymore, probably because of the pounding her feet take.  The trail up is moderate except a bit steeper toward the top.  Most of the trail is a pleasant walk through the woods (in other words, boring if you do a lot of hiking), but there are nice views on the way up.  The area around the three benches toward the top of Cougar Crest Trail (before you go over the saddle to the back side) are a peaceful place to stop if you're not going all the way up.   Past the saddle, and from the top of Bertha, you can see down into historic Holcomb Valley, where the town of Belleville used to be when there was gold there.", 'Great weather, fresh air, steep at times but nothing unbearable. Great panoramic view of the entire lake valley at the top, and got to see the PCT, pretty cool overall!', 'Beautiful views of the lake make this a rewarding hike!', 'Great views along the way to the top! The hike is decently steep incline the majority of the trek, but nothing too intimidating...', 'Great hike for kids', "This was a great hike! We took a 13 and 9 year old and had a great time. Easy hike with moderate elevation climb. Beautiful views! Couldn't ask for a better hike.", 'The weather was perfect at 64 degrees and starting out as 40. Great day!!', "This trail is simply beautiful. It's a nice leisurely hike with a gradual elevation gain, until you reach the climb for Bertha Peak. The climb gets your heart rate up, but isn't too difficult. The view at the top is amazing and well worth the effort. The trail is light to moderately traveled and very clean. It took about 3 hours round trip.", "Great hike with breath taking views! The Cougar Crest Trail itself is an easy climb in elevation (we didn't feel out of breath at all). It was a wonderful feeling to connect with the Pacific Crest Trail and walk on the famous trail for a bit. It was when we got to the sign for Bertha Peak that the work began! Quite the quick rise in elevation, but so worth it. Gorgeous views of Big Bear Lake and the ski areas. The trail info here shows that this is a 6.2 mile hike, but when we clocked it with our hike tracker we showed 7.6 miles... All in all a great hike that rewards the hiker with amazing scenery.", "Nice hike.  More than 90% of the trail snow covered, and last, steeper portion (on the road off the PCT) had ankle deep snow, making for a tough but rewarding slog up.  The hike was marred by folks with off-leash dogs that ran up and harassed my leashed dog.  This is the second time it's happened on this trail.  PLEASE keep your dogs leashed.", 'This trail is part of the PCT…need I say more. Of course it has that rugged Alpine feel as you climb and twist up the canyons to the crest. The views are outstanding. To get to BerthA Peak you need to take a fire road up. That is the biggest challenge and quite steep. After huffing and puffing to the top I saw a couple with their two Children 5&7y at the crest. Good Job!! Im impressed!
Last year and last time I did this trail I saw the largest Timber Rattler in my life! Today a saw a small child running blindly through the woods…..what ARE your PARENTS THINKING or are they?..thinking??', 'Nice easy going hike. Make sure to get an Adventure Pass or start from the Big Bear Discovery Center free of charge (only 0.6 mi away). Supposedly a well-used trail, we only ran into a couple hikers on our way down. Pretty view of the lake from the top. The incline is pretty gradual, but gets steep at times. Lots of rocks! Reduced our trail running quite a bit. Good easy-moderate hike!', 'Camped in bear with my buddy for two nights in June 2013 and tackled this trail first. Great hike for anyone! Nothing strenuous on this hike, good for a warm up. The Cougar Crest connects to the Pacific Crest which is pretty cool because that trail goes from Mexico all the way up through the U.S. and into Canada. Make sure to look for signs and continue to Bertha peak there are incredible views of Bear lake and Snow Summit and Bear resorts.', 'Completed this with 4 friends on 2/15. The views of the snow on bear mountain were pretty! No snow anywhere else, dry as a bone. Pretty easy but we stopped before the trail went behind the mountain. Gorgeous trees! ', 'Fun simple trail.   Did it with a group of five several years ago.  Bertha Peak was our highlight.', "Bagged Bertha in the winter of 2011.  Loved this hike  with great views of the Lake. I think what made this hike so exciting was that it had a lot of snow on trail. Wasn't a whole lot of people on the trail but there was a few at the top. The last 500 ft or so was kind of tuff but over all it wasn't bad. In the area you must hit up Bertha for sure."]

hike_name:
Bailey Canyon Trail to Jones Peak - California
 | AllTrails
hike_tags: ['dogs on leash', 'birding', 'hiking', 'nature trips', 'trail running', 'walking', 'forest', 'views', 'waterfall', 'wild flowers', 'wildlife', 'no shade']
hike_description: Bailey Canyon Trail to Jones Peak is a 6 mile lightly trafficked out and back trail located near Sierra Madre, California that features a waterfall and is rated as difficult. The trail offers a number of activity options and is accessible year-round. Dogs are also able to use this trail but must be kept on leash.

user_texts:
['I did this hike today Jan 19, 2 days after 3 straight days of LA rain. the trail is open and unobstructed. just like all the other reviews...it is steep, but worth it. poles definitely helpful.', 'The switchbacks are hard and slippery.  I slid down a few. The views are gorgeous all the way up.  I’m glad I was able to do this hike but won’t repeat it as I didn’t feel secure on many of the switchbacks.  Poles are essential.', 'This hike is great because it’s not too trafficked.  It’s challenging and eye catching with a constant view of the city', 'Did this trail two weeks ago on a Sunday. The trail doesn’t get too crowded which was great, but there are enough people around so you won’t get lost if you happen to go alone like I did. Got there close to 8am and the parking lot still had plenty of space. Signs are pretty visible once you see the starting path. Man! That first climb to the first bench. PHEW! I was beat. Total time for me to get to the Jones Peak was about 2 hrs with breaks. It wasn’t a clear day but the view was amazing nonetheless. Take your time. The inclines are pretty steep but the path is well maintained. It was a great experience. Would definitely do it again in fall/ winter and definitely not in full summer heat.', 'Lots of switchbacks & steep sunny incline. Nice and not at all crowded on a Sunday.', "indeed a very hard hike. it is actually 3.6 miles one way so 7.2 miles overall. lots of lizards but didn't spot any snakes. view from the top is good", 'Consider making this hike a loop by continuing past Jones Peak down the Connection Trail to the Mt. Wilson Trail and back to the town of Sierra Madre.', 'This has a fantastic view and perfect for a one-day workout', "Hiked during 95 Degree weather and oh boy was it hot. Saw about a thousand lizards on my way up. No snakes. When I reached the summit, there is a bench with fields of plants. Dozens of giant butterflies we're flying all around me, it was quite majestic.", 'I love this narrow little trail and I love the difficulty. Wear a bear bell and be mind-full though we have bears regularly in this area.', 'The hike is 6 miles round trip. Fairly steep elevation. Series of switchbacks to the top. Awesome views at the summit. Highly recommend this trail.', 'My first solo hike since moving to LA. Really nice, not crowded, great place to clear my head.', 'Very much a hike up and run down. At the the top, I was hoping for some runnable stuff but alas it was not to be. Nice views and mixed terrain if you want to improve and practice your footwork.', 'Fun trail. It’s a little short, but a good quick workout', 'It will remind you how young and in shape one is in a very stern but enjoyable way.  Definitely worth the continued and consistent experience and effort', 'Good hike, nice wide trail and steady incline. Ideal for trail running as well.', 'it was my first time hiking after a long time..it was time for me to get back out there. had an amazing time.', 'beautiful, easy climbing with some resting stops along the way to Jones Peak.', 'Good workout and some good views but hot if you don’t leave at the crack of dawn. I was the first one on the trail at a little past 6 am on a Saturday morning!!  It was wonderful.', 'I really enjoyed this hike, it was a great workout. Warning though to those who bring their dogs, it is a very dry, strenuous hike and the weather can feel 10-15 degrees hotter than it actually is; bring lots of water and take lots of breaks for your babies to prevent heat stroke. Stay safe', 'I don’t know why this trail is so highly rated. The waterfall (if you can call it that) is a mere trickle. This section of the trail (to the waterfall) is overgrown and poorly maintained. About a mile up the main trail, there are a couple benches with some lovely views of the city. But the rest of the hike is a real calf-buster—a brutal ascent with switchbacks that never seem to end. Unless you’re just in it for a good workout, I’d skip this one. There are no trees, no shade on this trail. I hiked it in the summertime, and it was almost unbearable.The peak does have some great views. But so does nearby Echo Mountain, and that trail has an interesting end point with resort and railroad ruins. If you’d like a good workout on a trail that is easily accessible, I’d recommend Echo Mountain over this.', 'Pretty easy hike with the exception of a short steep climb toward the peak.  Don’t cross the bridge...it’s not part of the trail.  Great views at the top.  Plenty of parking and easy to get to.  Downtown Sierra Madre is around the corner for brunch or coffee right after your hike!', 'Great trail.  My dog and I did this hike today towards the end of the day.  Love the lightly traveled aspect of it.  The switchbacks going up are super intense.  Run down!', 'Great trail with more options. Continue past Jones up steep hill to small white sign. To the right is the “Hiker Bob” trail that connects to the Mt Wilson trail from Sierra Madre.  To the left is Hastings Pk and the Mt Wilson toll road beyond.', 'Remember, slow and steady always wins! Two words: steep, switchbacks. Excellent workout! Parking available in a lot or neighborhood and there is a restroom at the start of the trail. I used trekking poles and wore hiking boots but it could be done without.', 'It has beautiful views and benches to enjoy view. It was great that there was very few people. People were weary friendly.', 'It’s a very beautiful place and amazing views Wear good shoes The hike is roughly 7 miles incline all the way up If you are scared of heights please do not go,there’s drops of 2000 feet Be very careful But it’s such a good workout Light traffic friendly people Parking is availble', 'Short and steep.  I measured 8.32 miles.The elevation gain is no joke...those switch backs and steep faces toward the top are what makes this trail "hard."  Be sure your boots/shoes are as tight as possible...I wear tactical boots and my feet were a little torn up from the incline.  With that said, this is an extremely beautiful hike, saturated with wildlife -- most of it is like walking through a forest.  Trail is immaculately clean and maintained, views are insane, and people are friendly.  What's more?  There are a ton of other trails to hook up with at the top, which can easily extend your hike another several miles/hours.', 'Breathtaking Views', 'It gets harder as you get to the peak. Very cool trail. Its enough exercise for me!', 'Amazing trail but be prepared if ur not in shape can get difficult as you get to the top.', 'Not recommended for a hot day.  It was around 90 degree today, and it was challenging.  First third of hike was pretty stiff, 2nd third was pretty easy, and last third has most altitude gain.  There was no view due to haze.', 'Great view and hike trail.', 'During the summer, start no later than 7am so you can beat the heat. Nice view once you get to the peak.', 'Go early before it gets too hot. This is a hard trail for a beginner as I found out, but well worth it.', 'Hard !', 'Great short climb that gets the heart rate UP!', 'Beautiful view and you meet people', "For inexperienced hikers this can be a bit strenuous. A lot of switchbacks and a lot of bugs. Once you get to the top the views are great. We started at 7am and at about 9am the temperature was already rising. A great hike to knock out in a few hours since it's local.", "Pretty tough for someone who doesn't hike often. There are lots of bugs (especially by the bench at the top), and most of the trail has no shade. The view is great, but try to go on a day when it is less hazy.", 'Nice hiking trail, found a little bit tough in the very last part to the peak. Not much shade. A lot of bugs and flys during this season (which is very annoying when you make stops to take pictures:( ) oh, and I saw snakes twice the way up to the peak so I suggest to bring your pole when doing this trail.', 'Worth the drive. Great workout and very clean.', "Steep with lots of short switchbacks. You'll be impressed with how quickly you climb up, but they views are usually pretty smoggy at the top.", "March 19th. 1hr 31mins up & 1hr 17mins down. Tough hike that isn't crowded. Apple Watch calculated about 7 miles.", '', '', 'Strenuous but beautiful.', 'Warm & beautiful day to hike today. Fresh air.', 'A good work out! You can stop at the top of Jones or keep going to continue on to much longer trails. I was moving at a decent speed at it took me 3 hours to finish. ', "Well maintained trail with decent views of the surrounding area. It'll be hard mostly because of the many switchbacks that keep going up. I think most should be able to do it if you take your time. It only took me a hour and a half to make it to the peak with a few water/picture breaks. But, I do a decent amount of hiking so I'm not the average person. Coming down was a lot quicker. Don't forget the sun screen. There are a few shaded spots, but they are far a few in between.", "Best workout for the distance.  Just put your head down and keep walking. Challenging but lovely. If you're feeling motivated to do more distance when you get to Jones Peak you can take the saddle over to the Mt. Wilson Trail where you come out just south of orchard camp. About 9-10 miles round trip.", "Although we only made it back the falls, and despite there being only a trickle of water, this trail provided a much needed stroll through our local woods. Fellow hikers were friendly, the air was fresh and crisp and the bird songs were enchanting. There is a small nature trail across from the bridge; we had fun reading and learning about the foothills' plant life. Picnic tables and live-edge wood benches can be found near the parking lot. Although the parking lot is on the smaller side it is gated; the area is posted as open from sunrise to sunset.", "This is a very steep hike with excellent views of the city. I did it on a cloudy and relatively cool day in about 3 hours (stops included). I can imagine it being very difficult on a hot and sunny day though, as there's barely any shade.", "Would not recommend if you don't start before 8am; little to no shade, dry winds. View is amazing, definite booty blaster", "Nice trail especially at spring time, when there are a lot of spring flowers in bloom. The hardest part of the trail is after George's cabin, when the switch backs get shorter and steeper.", 'It was great but I wished I could see something through the dense fog lots of great wild flowers during the spring!!!', '', "Awesome hike !!! Rewarded. Lots of switch backs but is worth it. Nice views and excellent workout. It's not too hard if you hike regularly. Beautiful.", "It's a tough trail with a lot of switchbacks, but it's great hiking.  I had to slow down but I can't wait to do it again.", 'Good workout. Don't be discouraged by the "hard" rating, it's more of a moderate hike.', 'Great hike steep ascend though', 'it may have seemed steeper than it actually was because of the heat. the trail is in great shape and the scenery at the top was great.', 'awsome so awsome we named our dog after this trail!!', 'this hike is definitely hard very good workout!', 'fairly hard hike with switch backs nice connection to mt wilson', 'Not a terribly difficult hike but it was extremely hot as most of the trail is in direct sunlight. Lots of quick switchbacks and some steep areas with slippery footing. Trails are narrow and most are on the edge of the mountain so not recommended for beginners. Bug spray and a wide-brimmed hat come in helpful. Nice views at the top.', 'It was a lot of fun !', "Great hike with some seriously amazing views. Near the bottom of the trail there's a lot of traffic from hikers to runners, but at the top you can be almost completely alone with some great views of la. Pretty strenuous but hike on!", 'definitely difficult for those not used to short switchbacks and a big incline. but your view and surroundings is enough to push you through those parts', "Amazing! Longest I've ever done and worth reach to the top of Jones Peak! And made friends along the way! Super nature active.", 'Good trail. Lots of sun, but a good workout.', 'Chill not a lot of people', 'It a all up hill did 3 miles but we ran out of time. Had to start coming down. Make sure when coming you bring lots of water and make sure your mouth is close or inhale with ur noise because their are lots of bugs. I swallow one or two. It was a great workout next time we plan of coming our goal is to make it all the way to the top and plenty of time to do so. Took us 2 hours doing 6 miles up and down.', 'We combined two trails: the Bailey Canyon Trail and the Mount Wilson Trail. The Bailey Canyon Trail was a good hike with some significant elevation change. When we reached the end of the Bailey Canyon trail on this map, we continued north and followed the connection to the Mount Wilson trail. Bailey Canyon is steep going up, so we were happy to climb that portion. Mount Wilson is less steep, so we were happy to go down that portion. We loved hearing the water and seeing all the green on the Mount Wilson trail, too.', "Trailhead is easy to find and the trail is very well maintained.  Once you go past the picnic/bbq area on the left side of the parking lot, you will find a gate to go through.  Go through the metal bars and you will end up on a road to the trail.  The total gain to Jones Peak is over 2,000 ft so there is a good amount of climbing to this hike, but the trail is not really rugged and the climb is actually not too bad until the last mile or so.  I wouldn't recommend this hike to children since the trail is quite narrow and it is probably too strenuous for young kids...unless of course your child loves the challenge and work out.  But considering my 4 year old shiba inu was able to do it I'm sure it's possible for anyone to do!  There is very little shade so it's probably better to start really early since it does get quite hot!  Definitely not a hike during the summer time.  Extra water is a good idea.  Lots of switchbacks, lots of bugs and LOTS of lizards.  We went on a somewhat hazy day so the scenery was actually not too fantastic....but the flowers were beautiful.  The last mile or so and the final climb to the peak (the alltrails end point is actually before the climb to the peak) is quite steep.  There is a bench at the peak where you can enjoy the view and have a small break/lunch.  There is another canyon you can climb behind this peak, which is actually higher with a steep ascend.  At the point where the alltrails track ends, you reach Jones Peak if you climb up the hill to the right.  If you go to the left, it lead you to the higher canyon.  I did see one person climbing that canyon and the view is probably even more amazing!  But after climbing more than 2,000 ft, it's really up to you how much more you want to climb.  The view from Jones Peak is a city view. There is definitely less people than Echo Mountain so there is more solitude!  Enough people to feel safe though.

Overall, great hike.  Take it slow and it should be fine.  The views are definitely not as breathtaking as the hikes on the other side of the San Gabriel Wilderness but is good enough for a hike close to Los Angeles.", 'Solid work out. Two much zigzag though', "Nice, steady 4 mile climb. Terrain doesn't change very much but great views.", "Good solid workout hike. Trail is well maintained. Upper parts of the trail have rocks. This trail gives sweeping views of the city below and the Catalina islands can be seen on a clearer day. I wouldn't want to do this straight uphill hike in the summer months.", "Nice hike if you're reasonably fit. I would rate it moderately strenuous. One person in our  party was not a hiker and appeared to struggle with the incline. Nice view at the top.", 'Hiked on a spring day w a slight drizzle. Good variety of wild flowers to keep my mind off the steep incline. Definitely one of the better trails. Not sure I would enjoy it during the height of LA summers.', 'There are three trails that I found. One goes to the waterless waterfall about 1/4 of a mile in. The one to the right, which I took, goes a very steep decent up to Jones Peak. The incline was pretty intense so I only went up 3.5 miles and turned around. Steep incline makes for steep decline, killer on the knees and ankles. The 3rd trail says it is a nature walk so I will save that one for another day. Parking in good and there is a restroom.', 'I went to the trail with a meet up group, the hike up was  a little difficult at first but half way up and seeing the view I was determined to get to the top. Once there is was so peaceful and worth getting to the top.', 'Bailey Canyon was a beautiful hike 3 years ago when the waterfall was lush, I was fortunate to experience this natural beauty before the drought. It sad to see the facts 43 years ago predicted about the ozone layer destruction because of the pollution. Now the Seasons are no longer 4 season in California, but nature is confused with sudden unusual heat waves in Winter and no rain, the birds try to peck and fooled trees that are trying to sprout fruit buds. 
What has the carelessness of man done to poor mother earth? 
It was sad to hike and then find what was once a humid lush waterfall, dry barren and shedding nothing but sandy soil. 
A uplifting part, which was nice to end the hike was that we took the nature trail walk for the first time and found some lush green meadows where  some huge trees had swings rigged up by some thoughtful hiker. They left some strong good rope and fashioned swings. They are is a perfect spot. Lots of bushy tailed squirrels too!
Pray for rain!', 'This is a wonderful hike above Sierra Madre with some great views of the city.  Less known than the mount Wilson trail thus more peaceful. Steep in a few places yet primarily on a narrow trail with switch backs at times. Fine for older kids yet it will be a bit long for them in reaching the top. Yes there are some areas with steeper drop offs from the trail yet I believe pretty safe for kids. If you just want a short hike after 15 minutes there is a spot with a great bench to sit on and look out over the town and distant city. Bring plenty of water and snacks as it is a vigorous hike to the top from which the view is great although the peak is barren with dirt and shrubs. One of my favorite hikes in the San Grabiels', "We did this trail to Jones peak and follow through up the ridge to connect with the old mount Wilson trail then back on July 7, 2013 as training for Half Dome. Starting at ~ 6:30 am helped with the ascent but by mid morning the trail was an exposed heat sink for the fastest hikers coming down. The ridge past Jones peak is long and steep, so pace yourself up to Jones peak  and don't try sprinting up the last 100 yds to the top of the peak or you will pay a price when ascending the ridge up to the toll road. Unless you are planning on doing a Special Forces mission and want to to push it to the red line, I would recommend doing this  hike as described to the old mt Wilson trail during the late fall, winter or early spring. During the summer the heat index is a real challenge and 4 liters of H2O is a minimum.", 'Great 3+ hour hike for anyone wanting a workout with the payoff of staggering views.Switchbacks on the narrow trail will take you up 2000 feet thru lovely foliage and overlooks. It was quite foggy today, and when we finally made it to the top there was no view to be had, but the entire way up was lovely. Bring plenty of water.', "I found this hike to be pretty difficult. The first set of switch backs are no joke. They're almost discouraging having one after another of steep inclines. And the trail is pretty narrow with steep drop offs. After the second vista it gets noticeably easier. It really gave my out of shape butt a serious workout. I made it to the third vista before running low on water and my shirt fully soaked through. I will attempt jones peak when my skill level improves.Definitely too dangerous for kids, dogs or mountain bikes. And if you are at all afraid of heights avoid this one. The views are both dizzying and staggeringly impressive.", "Trail is very strenuous with lots of switch backs. It took us more than 3 hrs to reach Jones Peak. It's a good work out trail. Make sure to bring water. ", "This trail follows the eastern edge of Bailey Canyon.  My son and I attempted it to Jones Pk. Almost made it, but we ran out of time and had to turn back.  We hiked 1/4 mile past the cabin ruins and quit.  The trail to Jones Peak is very narrow, very steep, and has very steep drops into the canyon beside the trail.  For this reason I wouldn't recommend it for small children.  We came across quite a few people coming down the trail.  I don't know this but I have a suspicion that they went up the Little Santa Anita Canyon trail and came down Bailey Canyon--which is probably what we should have done.  On the map Little Santa Anita looks to be a little easier to deal with on the uphill side.

There is also a waterfall trail in the canyon that doesn't go up the steep sides of the gorge.  This one may be suitable for children.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

hike_description: Vital Link Trail is a 3.2 mile moderately trafficked out and back trail located near Burbank, California that features beautiful wild flowers and is rated as difficult. The trail offers a number of activity options and is accessible year-round. Dogs are also able to use this trail but must be kept on leash.
